chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall kappa lambda : Cardinal, eq_cardinal kappa lambda -> le_cardinal kappa lambda

Premises:
Inductive eq_cardinal : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop := bij_eq_cardinal : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), bijective f -> eq_cardinal (cardinality X) (cardinality Y) Arguments bij_eq_cardinal {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive le_cardinal : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop := inj_le_cardinal : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), injective f -> le_cardinal (cardinality X) (cardinality Y) Arguments inj_le_cardinal {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive Cardinal : Type := cardinality : Type -> Cardinal Arguments cardinality _%type_scope
lt_cardinal = fun kappa lambda : Cardinal => le_cardinal kappa lambda /\ ~ eq_cardinal kappa lambda : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop
ge_cardinal = fun kappa lambda : Cardinal => le_cardinal lambda kappa : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop
gt_cardinal = fun kappa lambda : Cardinal => lt_cardinal lambda kappa : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop
eq_cardinal_ind : forall P : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop, (forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), bijective f -> P (cardinality X) (cardinality Y)) -> forall c c0 : Cardinal, eq_cardinal c c0 -> P c c0
le_cardinal_sind : forall P : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> SProp, (forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), injective f -> P (cardinality X) (cardinality Y)) -> forall c c0 : Cardinal, le_cardinal c c0 -> P c c0
eq_cardinal_sind : forall P : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> SProp, (forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), bijective f -> P (cardinality X) (cardinality Y)) -> forall c c0 : Cardinal, eq_cardinal c c0 -> P c c0
le_cardinal_ind : forall P : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop, (forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), injective f -> P (cardinality X) (cardinality Y)) -> forall c c0 : Cardinal, le_cardinal c c0 -> P c c0
Cardinal_sind : forall P : Cardinal -> SProp, (forall T : Type, P (cardinality T)) -> forall c : Cardinal, P c
Cardinal_rec : forall P : Cardinal -> Set, (forall T : Type, P (cardinality T)) -> forall c : Cardinal, P c
Cardinal_ind : forall P : Cardinal -> Prop, (forall T : Type, P (cardinality T)) -> forall c : Cardinal, P c
Cardinal_rect : forall P : Cardinal -> Type, (forall T : Type, P (cardinality T)) -> forall c : Cardinal, P c
bij_eq_cardinal : forall f : ?X -> ?Y, bijective f -> eq_cardinal (cardinality ?X) (cardinality ?Y) where ?X : [ |- Type] ?Y : [ |- Type]
inj_le_cardinal : forall f : ?X -> ?Y, injective f -> le_cardinal (cardinality ?X) (cardinality ?Y) where ?X : [ |- Type] ?Y : [ |- Type]
eq_cardinal_equiv = {| equiv_refl := fun x : Cardinal => match x as c return (eq_cardinal c c) with | cardinality T => bij_eq_cardinal (fun x0 : T => x0) (conj (fun (x0 y : T) (H : x0 = y) => H) (fun y : T => ex_intro (fun x0 : T => x0 = y) y eq_refl)) end; equiv_trans := fun (x y z : Cardinal) (H : eq_cardinal x y) (H0 : eq_cardinal y z) => match H in (eq_cardinal c c0) return (eq_cardinal c0 z -> eq_cardinal c z) with | @bij_eq_cardinal X Y f H1 => fun H2 : eq_cardinal (cardinality Y) z => let H3 : cardinality Y = cardinality Y -> z = z -> eq_cardinal (cardinality X) z := match H2 in (eq_cardinal c c0) return (c = cardinality Y -> c0 = z -> eq_cardinal (cardinality X) z) with | @bij...
Ring_polynom.Pphi : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R

Relation_Operators.clos_refl_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : relation A) (x : A) (P : A -> Prop), (forall y : A, R x y -> P y) -> P x -> forall a : A, Relation_Operators.clos_refl A R x a -> P a

Included = fun (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) => forall x : U, In B x -> In C x : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Prop Arguments Included {U}%type_scope
surjective = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) => forall y : Y, exists x : X, f x = y : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> Prop Arguments surjective {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
inclusion = fun (A : Type) (R1 R2 : relation A) => forall x y : A, R1 x y -> R2 x y : forall A : Type, relation A -> relation A -> Prop Arguments inclusion {A}%type_scope
EnvRing.mkPX : forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> EnvRing.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.Pol C -> EnvRing.Pol C
Ring_polynom.mkPX : forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C

Ring_polynom.PEmul : forall C : Type, Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C

intros kappa lambda H.
inversion H.
